p: Thus human infection seems inevitable during RVF epizootics. RVFV amplification cycles in livestock frequently precede human cases by 34 weeks, and play a critical role in the early stages of an outbreak. The highly viraemic (virus circulated in blood) animals serve as an excellent source of direct contamination of humans, as well as a blood meal source for mosquitoes which can transmit the virus to humans [ 30]. The same finding was obtained by the analysis of livestock and human data in the RVFV outbreak in Kenya (2006 and 2007) which suggests livestock infections would be occurred before virus detection in humans [ 31].
